title: Length of rope and mass of student

content.question:
A rope hangs from a tree that is on Earth’s surface. Student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> holds on to the end of a rope and hangs from rest. Student <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> exerts a force onto student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> so that student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> undergoes simple harmonic motion while hanging onto the rope. Air resistance is considered to be negligible. Graph 1 shows the vertical position of student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time. Graph 2 shows the speed of student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of the student’s vertical position.

What is the approximate length of the rope and the mass of the student if the maximum gravitational potential energy of the student-Earth system is <math alttext="2000 joules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: Length of Rope <math alttext="in meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Mass of Student <math alttext="in kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 2.5 41

Length of Rope <math alttext="in meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Mass of Student <math alttext="in kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 2.5 82

Length of Rope <math alttext="in meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Mass of Student <math alttext="in kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 3.1 41

Length of Rope <math alttext="in meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Mass of Student <math alttext="in kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 3.1 82

content.answer: Length of Rope <math alttext="in meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Mass of Student <math alttext="in kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 3.1 82

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
